column3: A false positive about the document case
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_naming.html#ClassTypeParameterName I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java class MyClass1 {}        // violation class MyClass2 {}        // violation class MyClass3 {}      // violation class MyClass4 {} // violation class MyClass5 {} // OK  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/vanguard/projects/SAMutator/tools/Test.java:2:16: Name 't' must match pattern '(^[A-Z][0-9]?)$|([A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*[T]$)'. [ClassTypeParameterName] [ERROR] /home/vanguard/projects/SAMutator/tools/Test.java:3:16: Name 'abc' must match pattern '(^[A-Z][0-9]?)$|([A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*[T]$)'. [ClassTypeParameterName] [ERROR] /home/vanguard/projects/SAMutator/tools/Test.java:4:16: Name 'LISTENER' must match pattern '(^[A-Z][0-9]?)$|([A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*[T]$)'. [ClassTypeParameterName] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors. ``` --- **Describe what you expect in detail.** --- Actually, this is a document case, it is the last example of [Examples](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_naming.html#ClassTypeParameterName_Examples). The document has been tagged 4 violations, but actually Checkstyle can only detect 3 violations, except the line 1. Thanks.

column3: False Negative: RedundantModifierCheck
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_modifier.html#RedundantModifier I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java package tmp;  public interface Test {     public static interface foo { // violation for 'static', no violation for 'public'     }      public static enum someEnum { // violation for both     }      public static class someClass { // violation for both     }      public static record someRecord() { // violation for none, will be fixed in #11259     }      public static @interface someAnnInterface { // violation for none     } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:4:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:7:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:7:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:10:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:10:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 5 errors.  ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.** ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:4:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:4:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:7:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:7:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:10:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:10:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:13:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:13:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:16:5: Redundant 'public' modifier. [RedundantModifier] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:16:12: Redundant 'static' modifier. [RedundantModifier] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 10 errors. ``` Every member class or interface declaration in the body of an interface declaration is implicitly public and static. See [JLS](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.5) for more info. Comments in code specify the current behavior.

column3: A false negative about the rule ClassMemberImpliedModifier
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_modifier.html#ClassMemberImpliedModifier I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                       /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {   Object obj = new Object() {     public record BadRecord() {}  // should report a warning in this line   }; }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` --- **Describe what you expect in detail.** --- Hi, I found a false negative about the rule ClassMemberImpliedModifier. CheckStyle should have reported a warning in line 3. But it does not. Thanks for your consideration. Static modifier is expected to be present.

column3: MissingJavadocMethod should consider nested class
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#MissingJavadocMethod I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {   class subTest {     public void test() {}  // should report a warning here   } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c ./cs.config Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  --- **Describe what you expect in detail.** --- Hi, I found a false negative about this rule. CheckStyle should have reported a warning in line 3 and this FN is caused by the inner class `subTest`. Thanks for your consideration.

column3: JavadocStyleCheck should report violation on AST element (line and column)
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#JavadocStyle I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  Found this issue when trying to resolve #8151 : `XpathRegressionJavadocStyleTest`  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac SuppressionXpathRegressionJavadocStyle.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                   /var/tmp $ cat SuppressionXpathRegressionJavadocStyle.java     package main;        public class SuppressionXpathRegressionJavadocStyle {    /**       * Some description here. // OK      */    private void methodWithValidCommentStyle() {}         /** // violation is here      * Some description here  // but I would expect violation here      */    private void methodWithInvalidCommentStyle() {}    }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml \     SuppressionXpathRegressionJavadocStyle.java   Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\opensource\config_checkstyle\src\main\   SuppressionXpathRegressionJavadocStyle.java:9: First sentence should end with a period. [JavadocStyle] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 error. ```   **Describe what you expect in detail.**  --- It gives a violation on line 9 as the First sentence should end with a period. But I expect a violation at line `10:27` after here`.`  problem is lines like: `log(comment.getStartLineNo() .....` logging of violation should be AST based.  Nuances: We do validation of first line by different and more advanced Check - https://checkstyle.org/config_javadoc.html#SummaryJavadoc , we do not need duplication of functionality.  JavadocStyle is uber Check that do a lot validations, we need to split it in few Checks and refactor it to be based on AbstractJavadocCheck. Example: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/b09a9ce9d4f48c179f3d5647b6656e5737462656/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/javadoc/SummaryJavadocCheck.java#L217

column3: SuppressionXpathSingleFilter suppresses all violations when used with the default configuration
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_filters.html#SuppressionXpathSingleFilter I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                            /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test { // expected violation as all properties of filter are null. }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  The default configuration has all the properties set to null but still the violation is suppressed, if I remove or comment the filter then a violation is thrown- ```xml                       ``` ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:1:1: Missing a Javadoc comment. [MissingJavadocType] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```

column3: FinalClassCheck: False positive with anonymous classes
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_design.html#FinalClass I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```xml                        ``` ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java public class Test {      class a { // expected no violation         private a() {         }     }      a obj = new a() {     }; } ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:3:5: Class a should be declared as final. [FinalClass] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.** ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` This was supposed to be fixed in #9357. Making the class final results in a compile-time error.

column3: False Negative: VariableDeclarationUsageDistance
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#VariableDeclarationUsageDistance I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public Test test(Object a) {         int pc = 0; // expected violation         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test(pc).test("abc");         return this;     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:3:9: Distance between variable 'pc' declaration and its first usage is 7, but allowed 3.  Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value). [VariableDeclarationUsageDistance] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  Works perfectly fine with following piece of code- ```java public class Test {     public Test test(Object a) {         int pc = 0; // expected violation, got a violation         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test("abc").test("abc");         test(pc);         return this;     } } ```

column3: False Positive: UnusedLocalVariableCheck
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#UnusedLocalVariable I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```xml                        ``` ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java public class Test {      static class m {         static class h {             public int a = 12;         }     }      static class j {         static void method() {             int a = 1000; // unexpected violation             m.h obj = new m.h() { // object of Test.j.m.h and not of Test.m.h                 @Override                 void method() {                     System.out.println("a = " + a); // local var a                 }             };             obj.method();         }          static class m {             static class h {                 void method() {                 }             }         }     }      public static void main(String[] args) {         j.method();     } } ``` ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:11:13: Unused local variable 'a'. [UnusedLocalVariable] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ``` /var/tmp $ java Test.java a = 1000 ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.** ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  ---  Discovered while working on #11365, the source has been identified, the fix has been done locally, will be pushed soon.

column3: False Negative: UnnecessaryParenthesesCheck
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#UnnecessaryParentheses I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     void method() {         boolean a = true;         boolean b = false;         if(a || (b ^ a) || b) { // expected violation         }         if(a || (b | a) || b) { // expected violation         }         if(a || (b & a) || b) { // expected violation         }         int c = 1;         int d = 12;         if(a || (c ^ d) >> 1 == 1 || b) { // ok         }     } } /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.** ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/vyom/IdeaProjects/ConfigCheckstyle/src/TestP/Test.java:5:17: Unnecessary parentheses around expression. [UnnecessaryParentheses] [ERROR] /home/vyom/IdeaProjects/ConfigCheckstyle/src/TestP/Test.java:7:17: Unnecessary parentheses around expression. [UnnecessaryParentheses] [ERROR] /home/vyom/IdeaProjects/ConfigCheckstyle/src/TestP/Test.java:9:17: Unnecessary parentheses around expression. [UnnecessaryParentheses] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors.  ``` Currently, the check does not identify any of `|`, `&` and `^`. Though we have had reports that UnnecessaryParentheses is too strict ([example](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/10946)) so it would be better to discuss whether adding support for it will be worth it.

column3: StringLiteralEquality FN about String literal expression
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#StringLiteralEquality I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                            /var/tmp $ cat Test.java class Test {     public void foo() {         String status = "pending";         if (status == "do" + "ne") {} // violation     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  --- Hi, I found a false negative about the rule StringLiteralEquality. At line 4, it is obvious that right value is string literal, but no violation report. I think this is resulted by string literal expression. Thanks for your consideration.

column3: False negative about SimplifyBooleanReturn
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#SimplifyBooleanReturn I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                               /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {   private boolean cond;   public boolean check1() {     if (cond) { // should report a warning here       return true || false;     } else {       return false;     }   } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  **Describe what you expect in detail.** Hi, I found a false negative about the rule SimplifyBooleanReturn. For the code example above, CheckStyle should have report a warning in line 5 because this is a literal expression and it is directly equal to `true` in bytecode level. Hence, I think this is a false negative. Thanks for your consideration.

column3: RequireThisCheck giving multiple violation for classes nested in lambdas.
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#RequireThis I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```XML                            ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java import java.util.function.Consumer;  public interface Test {      private static void method(Consumer consumer) {         consumer.accept("foo");     }      private void testCtorNestedInLambda() {         method(s -> {             class InnerSubscriber implements Test {                 int index;                  public InnerSubscriber(int index) {                     index = index; // 2 violations, expected 1                 }             }         });     } } ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:15:21: Reference to instance variable 'index' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:15:29: Reference to instance variable 'index' needs "this.". [RequireThis] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ``` It is giving violation for both sides, the check is trying to imply `this.index = this.index` which isn't correct.

column3: RequireThisCheck not able to handle try-with-resources
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#RequireThis I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```XML                            ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java import java.io.BufferedReader; import java.io.IOException; import java.io.InputStreamReader;  public class Test {      public BufferedReader instFld2;       void method() {         try (BufferedReader instFld2 = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(null, "utf-8"))) {         }         catch (IOException e) {         }     } } ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:10:29: Reference to instance variable 'instFld2' needs "this.". [RequireThis] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  The violation is given for resource definition, which is not expected.

column3: Null pointer exception with records in RequireThisCheck
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#RequireThis I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```XML                ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java public record Test(int a) {      void method() {         String a = "BUG";         a = a.substring(0, 1);     } } ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Exception was thrown while processing Test.java         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.processFiles(Checker.java:305)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.process(Checker.java:224)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:407)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.RequireThisCheck$ClassFrame.hasFinalField(RequireThisCheck.java:1557)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.RequireThisCheck.canAssignValueToClassField(RequireThisCheck.java:932)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.RequireThisCheck.getClassFrameWhereViolationIsFound(RequireThisCheck.java:731)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.RequireThisCheck.getFieldWithoutThis(RequireThisCheck.java:517)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.RequireThisCheck.processIdent(RequireThisCheck.java:469)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.RequireThisCheck.visitToken(RequireThisCheck.java:403)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.notifyVisit(TreeWalker.java:335)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.processIter(TreeWalker.java:406)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.walk(TreeWalker.java:273)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.processFiltered(TreeWalker.java:154)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractFileSetCheck.process(AbstractFileSetCheck.java:87)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.processFile(Checker.java:331)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.processFiles(Checker.java:292)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  This was discovered at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11805#issuecomment-1172370264.  Relevant AST- ``` RECORD_DEF -> RECORD_DEF   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS  |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public  |--LITERAL_RECORD -> record  |--IDENT -> Test  |--LPAREN -> (  |--RECORD_COMPONENTS -> RECORD_COMPONENTS  |   `--RECORD_COMPONENT_DEF -> RECORD_COMPONENT_DEF  |       |--ANNOTATIONS -> ANNOTATIONS  |       |--TYPE -> TYPE  |       |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int  |       `--IDENT -> a ```  ### Reason: The main reason for this happening is due to the fact that record instance members (record components) don't have any modifier (they are implicitly `private` and `final`). AST does not show any `TokenTypes.MODIFIERS` for record components (which is correct) and the condition at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/b87a6c002c72983f012dcee8c414762a681b5940/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/RequireThisCheck.java#L1529-L1540 expects `TokenTypes.MODIFIERS` so we get an NPE.

column3: A false negative about the rule NestedForDepth
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#NestedForDepth I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                        /var/tmp $ cat Test.java import java.util.*; public class Test {     public void foo() {         ArrayList list = new ArrayList();         list.add(1);         list.add(2);         list.forEach((i) -> {             for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {               for(int k = 0; k < 2; k++) { // can this be violation ??                 // should report a warning               }             }         });         for(Integer i : list) {           for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {             for(int k = 0; k < 2; k++) { // violation               // can be detected             }           }         }     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:16:13: Nested for depth is 2 (max allowed is 1). [NestedForDepth] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  --- **Describe what you expect in detail.** --- Hi, I found this rule is also caused by new java characteristic. Checkstyle should report a warning at line 9, but it doesn't. However, the code commented below can be detected and they care equivalent. Thanks for your consideration.

column3: FallThrough check false positive with labelled break
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#FallThrough I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```cmd > javac Test.java (success)  > type config.xml                      > type Test.java public class Test {     public int test(int a, int b) {         top: switch (a) {             case 1:                 switch (b) {                     case 10:                         break top;                     default:                         return 11;                 }             case 2: // line 11                 return 2;         }         return -1;     } }  > java -jar checkstyle-0.2.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] Test.java:11:13: Fall through from previous branch of the switch statement. [FallThrough] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  ---  Expected result is no errors.  This code never falls through from case 1 to case 2.  The problem seems to only happen with a labelled break.  If I use `return 11` instead of `break top` then checkstyle does not find a problem.

column3: FallThrough should recognize yield also
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#FallThrough I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac InputFallThrough3.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                /var/tmp $ cat InputFallThrough3.java /* FallThrough checkLastCaseGroup = (default)false reliefPattern = (default)falls?[ -]?thr(u|ough)   */  //non-compiled with javac: Compilable with Java14 package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.fallthrough;  public class InputFallThrough3 {     int hasYield() {         return switch (hashCode()) {         case 1:             yield 1;         case 2: // (Line 18) Should be OK             yield 2;         case 3: // (Line 20) Should be OK             int i = 1;             // fall through         case 4: // OK         default: // OK, case does not contain code             yield -1;         };     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3-all.jar -c config.xml InputFallThrough3.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/InputFallThrough3.java:18:9: Fall through from previous branch of the switch statement. [FallThrough] [ERROR] /var/tmp/InputFallThrough3.java:20:9: Fall through from previous branch of the switch statement. [FallThrough] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  FallThrough should recognize `yield` as termination also. It can only appear in Java 14+ switch expressions and should be treated the same as `return`. All entries should not be reported as a violation.

column3: RegexpMultiline: matches inside text blocks
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_xxxxxx.html#NameOfAffectedCheck I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash %  javac scratch_1.java                                            %  cat config.xml                                                                                            %  cat scratch_1.java                                             class Scratch {     public static void main(String[] args)     {         String s = """                 CREATE TABLE table (                     col integer                 )                 """;     } }  %  RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" %  java -jar checkstyle-10.3-all.jar -c config.xml scratch_1.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /Users/kudivuhadi/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/IntelliJIdea2022.2/scratches/scratch_1.java:8: Whitespace character before closing parenthesis [RegexpMultiline] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  ---  The pattern in the `RegexpMultiline` configuration is supposed to complain about stray white spaces in Java code, so I would consider the error reported above a false positive, because it points to contents of a text block, which is not Java.

column3: Indentation: false positives when switch expression is invocation target
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#Indentation I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash %  javac scratch_1.java  %  cat config.xml                                    %  cat scratch_1.java  class Scratch {     public static void main(String[] args)     {         (switch (args.length) {             case 1 -> args[0];             case 2 -> args[1];             default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException();         }).length();          String s = switch (args.length) {             case 1 -> args[0];             case 2 -> args[1];             default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException();         };         s.length();     } }  %  RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"  %  java -jar checkstyle-10.3-all.jar -c config.xml scratch_1.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /Users/kudivuhadi/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/IntelliJIdea2022.2/scratches/scratch_1.java:6:13: 'case' child has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 16. [Indentation] [ERROR] /Users/kudivuhadi/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/IntelliJIdea2022.2/scratches/scratch_1.java:7:13: 'case' child has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 16. [Indentation] [ERROR] /Users/kudivuhadi/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/IntelliJIdea2022.2/scratches/scratch_1.java:8:13: 'case' child has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 16. [Indentation] [ERROR] /Users/kudivuhadi/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/IntelliJIdea2022.2/scratches/scratch_1.java:9:9: 'switch rcurly' has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 12. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 4 errors. ```  ---  The `main` method contains two switch expressions: the first is immediately used as a target of method invocation, the second does the same, but its value is first assigned to an intermediate variable. `Indentation` reports errors for the first switch, but not the second. This is similar to #8929, which (I believe) fixed it for the second switch.

column3: FinalParameters in checkstyle 9.2.1 gives error for records without final on parameters in constructor when having more than one constructor
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#FinalParameters I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac DemoRecordOneConstructor.java /var/tmp $ javac DemoRecordTwoConstructors.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                          /var/tmp $ cat DemoRecordOneConstructor.java  public record DemoRecordOneConstructor(String name,int age){ }  /var/tmp $ cat DemoRecordTwoConstructors.java public record DemoRecordTwoConstructors(String name,int age){     public DemoRecordTwoConstructors(String name){         this(name,50);    } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2.1-all.jar -c config.xml DemoRecordOneConstructor.java  Starting audit... Audit done.  /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2.1-all.jar -c config.xml DemoRecordTwoConstructors.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /Users/kajh/tmp/checkstyle/DemoRecordTwoConstructors.java:4:37: Parameter name should be final. [FinalParameters] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` --- For records in java constructorparameters should not be required to be final when I use ``````. This works fine with one constructor as shown with DemoRecordOneConstructor.java, but when I have two constructors I get an error when not having ```final``` on the parameters of the second constructor as shown with DemoRecordTwoConstructors.java. ---

column3: CustomImportOrder not working as expected
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_imports.html#CustomImportOrder I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```cmd /var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java Yes, no errors  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml #[[                                                                            ]] ```  ```cmd /var/tmp $ type HelloWorld.java #[[$ type src\se\pkg1\pkgx\HelloWorld.java                                    package se.pkg1.pkgx;                                                                                                                                 import third.party.SomeClassThirdParty;                                                                          import se.pkg1.pkgnotx.SomeClassY1;                                                                                                                   import se.pkg1.pkgx.SomeClassX1;                                           import se.pkg1.pkgx.SomeClassX2;                                                                                                                      class HelloWorld {                                                           public static void main(String[] args) {                                     SomeClassThirdParty someClassThirdParty = new SomeClassThirdParty();       someClassThirdParty.noOp();                                                SomeClassY1 someClassY1 = new SomeClassY1();                               someClassY1.noOp();                                                        SomeClassX1 someClassX1 = new SomeClassX1();                               someClassX1.noOp();                                                        SomeClassX2 someClassX2 = new SomeClassX2();                               someClassX2.noOp();                                                      }                                                                        } ]] ```  ```cmd set RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" java %RUN_LOCALE% -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml YOUR_FILE.java ``` $ java %run_locale% -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c config.xml src\se\pkg1\pkgx\HelloWorld.java Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\gitco\checkstyle-bug-report\src\se\pkg1\pkgx\HelloWorld.java:4:1: 'se.pkg1.pkgnotx.SomeClassY1' should be separated from previous import group by one line. [CustomImportOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.** Expected order I think should be as in HelloWorld.java.  Since _se.pkg1.pkgnotx_ is defined as THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE I think it should be in THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group even though SPECIAL_IMPORTS is defined as _se.pkg1_ since matching against THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE is more specific than SPECIAL_IMPORTS.  Also SAME_PACKAGE(3) should not be relevant if they are in se.pkg1.pkgx.* only if they are in se.pkg1.*.   _A side note._ The example codebase is a bit weird where I have _se.pkg1.pkgx_ and _se.pkg1.pkgnotx_ in the same folder structure where _se.pkg1.pkgnotx_ is a dependency from maven, created from another part of my organization so for my team/application's point of view it's considered third party but I get the same behavior in this example codebase as in my regular codebase. ---

column3: FinalClassCheck should report private classes without constructor
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_design.html#FinalClass I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac -verbose --enable-preview --source=17 TestClass.java [checking TestClass] [loading /modules/java.base/java/io/Serializable.class] [loading /modules/java.base/java/lang/AutoCloseable.class] [wrote TestClass$Private.class] [wrote TestClass.class] [total 113ms]  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```xml          		       ```  ```bash /var/tmp $ cat TestClass.java ``` ```java class TestClass { 	private class Private {} // Expected violation } ``` ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.3-all.jar -c config.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` ---  From the check [description](https://checkstyle.org/config_design.html#FinalClass_Description) > Checks that a class which has only private constructors is declared as final.  The [specs](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.8.9) says that > The default constructor has the same access modifier as the class.  Thus, if a **private** class has no ctor, it should be declared as `final`.  Identified [here](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10968/files#r812524157) by @rnveach

column3: VariableDeclarationUsageDistance not able to handle try with resources properly
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#VariableDeclarationUsageDistance I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java ``` ``` /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```XML                                   ``` ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java public class Test {     void method() {         String a = ""; // no violation expected         try (AutoCloseable i = new java.io.StringReader(a)) {         }         catch (Exception e) {             throw new RuntimeException(e);         }     } } ``` ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:3:9: Distance between variable 'a' declaration and its first usage is 2, but allowed 1.  Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value). [VariableDeclarationUsageDistance] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` No error was expected, the variable is used just after it was declared, plus in the source code, there is no mention of `TokenTypes.RESOURCES` so this seems like a false positive.

column3: UnnecessaryParentheses reports incorrect violation message for return value in lambdas
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#UnnecessaryParentheses I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```shell $ javac ParenthesesTest.java # ParenthesesTest.class created  $ type config.xml                                         $ type ParenthesesTest.java import java.util.function.Function;  public class ParenthesesTest {     public void returnValueExample() {         Function addFive = x -> {             return (x + 5); // violation, should be reported for parentheses around return value         };     } }  $ java "-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml ParenthesesTest.java Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\Users\Faraaz\CheckstyleTest\ParenthesesTest.java:6:20: Unnecessary parentheses around assignment right-hand side. [UnnecessaryParentheses] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  When a lambda expression is assigned to a variable and has a return value surrounded in parentheses, the violation reported is ' Unnecessary parentheses around assignment right-hand side.'.  **Expected:** The correct violation message should be 'Unnecessary parentheses around return value.'. ParenthesesTest.java:6:20 should be reported for unnecessary parentheses around return value.  ---  Could it be due to [this](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/4981aad0c6a4270f618fcab1b50a00c0c22a33f0/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/UnnecessaryParenthesesCheck.java#L585), wherein the assignment depth is being checked **before** checking whether the parent token is a 'return'?

column3: SimplifyBooleanReturn false negatives
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#SimplifyBooleanReturn I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                    /var/tmp $ cat Test.java // Taken from tests: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/simplifybooleanreturn/InputSimplifyBooleanReturn.java public class Test {     public static boolean isOddMillis()     {         boolean even = System.currentTimeMillis() % 2 == 0;          // can be simplified to "if (even)"         if (even == true) { // violation             return false;         }         else {             return true;         }         // return can be simplified to "return !even"     }      public static boolean isOddMillis2()     {         boolean even = System.currentTimeMillis() % 2 == 0;         // can be simplified to "return !even"         if (!even) // violation             return true;         else             return false;     }      public static boolean giveMeTrue()     {         boolean tt = isOddMillis() || true;         boolean ff = isOddMillis() && false;         return !false || (true != false);     }      public boolean ifNoElse()     {         if (isOddMillis()) {             return true;         }         return false;     }      boolean a() {         boolean asd = false;         boolean dasa = true;          if (asd) {             return true;         } else {             return dasa;         }     }      boolean aa() {         boolean asd = false;         boolean dasa = true;          if (asd) {             return dasa;         } else {             return true;         }     }      boolean b() {         boolean asd = false;          if(asd);         else;          return true;     } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java -jar $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/checkstyle/Test.java:9:9: Conditional logic can be removed. [SimplifyBooleanReturn] [ERROR] /var/tmp/checkstyle/Test.java:22:9: Conditional logic can be removed. [SimplifyBooleanReturn] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  ---  I expect this check to also handle other cases from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/simplifybooleanreturn/InputSimplifyBooleanReturn.java, though it seems like only the first two cases are currently being handled.

column3: ParameterAssignment does not detect problem for Lambda parameters
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#ParameterAssignment I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash $ cat config.xml                         $ cat Test.java  import java.util.*; public class Test {     public void foo() {         ArrayList list = new ArrayList();         list.add(1);         list.add(2);         list.forEach((i) -> {             i *= 10;  // should report a warning         });     } }  $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  violation is expected at ` i *= 10;  // should report a warning` line

column3: Make ModifiedControlVariable detect forEach loop
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#ModifiedControlVariable I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                        /var/tmp $ cat Test.java import java.util.*; public class Test {     public void foo() {         ArrayList list = new ArrayList();         list.add(1);         list.add(2);         list.forEach((i) -> {             i *= 10;  // should report a warning         });         for(Integer i : list) {             i *= 10;  // can be detected         }     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:11:15: Control variable 'i' is modified. [ModifiedControlVariable] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  --- **Describe what you expect in detail.** --- Hi, I found a false negative caused by new java characteristic. Checkstyle should report a warning at line 8, but it doesn't. However, the code commented below can be detected and they care equivalent. Thanks.

column3: MissingSwitchDefault for switch exception (Java 14+)
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#MissingSwitchDefault I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Main.java #[[MAKE SURE THERE IS SUCCESSFUL COMPILATION]]  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                   /var/tmp $ cat Main.java import java.nio.file.AccessMode;  public class Main {    private void createPlatform() {     switch (AccessMode.READ) {       case READ -> "1";       case WRITE -> "2";       case EXECUTE -> "3";     };   } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2.1-all.jar -c config.xml Main.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/gtx/Downloads/Main.java:7:12: switch without "default" clause. [MissingSwitchDefault] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` **Expected**: no errors. Following code is very similar and does not produce any errors: ```java   private void createPlatform() {     String mode = switch (AccessMode.READ) {       case READ -> "1";       case WRITE -> "2";       case EXECUTE -> "3";     };   }    private String createPlatform() {     return switch (AccessMode.READ) {       case READ -> "1";       case WRITE -> "2";       case EXECUTE -> "3";     };   } ``` Given javac won't compile non-exhaustive switch, maybe `MissingSwitchDefault` check should be no-op for switch exceptions? Sample javac error: ```bash /var/tmp $ cat Main.java  import java.nio.file.AccessMode;  public class Main {    private String createPlatform() {     return switch (AccessMode.READ) {       case WRITE -> "2";       case EXECUTE -> "3";     };   } }  /var/tmp $ javac Main.java Main.java:6: error: the switch expression does not cover all possible input values     return switch (AccessMode.READ) {            ^ 1 error ``` Related to #10463 and #10866

column3: RightCurly: Google style config does not detect misplaced '}' for annotation declaration and enum
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_blocks.html#RightCurly I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11585#discussion_r866844938 this input file is part of our regression code base: ```bash $ cat Test.java  class Test {   public @interface TestAnnotation {}    public @interface TestAnnotation1 { String someValue(); }    public @interface TestAnnotation2 {     String someValue(); }  // line 7, it should be warn !!!    public @interface TestAnnotation3 {     String someValue();   } //ok    public @interface TestAnnotation4 { String someValue();   } //ok    enum TestEnum2 {     SOME_VALUE; } // line 17, it should be warn !!! }  $ java -classpath checkstyle-10.2-all.jar com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main \         -c /google_checks.xml Test.java  Starting audit... Audit done. ```  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  there should be violation on line 7 and 17. from google style https://checkstyle.org/styleguides/google-java-style-20180523/javaguide.html#s4.1.2-blocks-k-r-style >Line break before the closing brace  so we have defect.  removal of following suppression module from google config make violations appear on lines: ```                                 ```

column3: RightCurly alone_or_singleline in single-line try..catch constructs
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_blocks.html#RightCurly I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac RCurlyTest.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                                                /var/tmp $ cat RCurlyTest.java public class RCurlyTest { 	public static void main(String args[]) { 		try { System.out.println(args[0]); } catch (Exception e) {} 	} }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml RCurlyTest.java Starting audit... [ERROR] [...]/RCurlyTest.java:3:44: '}' at column 38 should be alone on a line. [RightCurly] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  Since the whole try..catch construct is in a single line, I expect the RightCurly test to pass (i.e. no errors raised).  As a side-note. Column number in the error message seems to be wrong when tabs are used in the source file. In the above example you can see that:   * RCurlyTest.java:3:44 is correct and honours the top level tabWidth property in the config.xml file  * However the message incorrectly refers to "column 38"

column3: Enhance logging approach of SummaryJavadocCheck and use AST-based approach to get content of inline tag.
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#SummaryJavadoc I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {      /**      * {@summary Missing period}      */     void foo() {     }      /**      * {@summary Missing period      * and having multiple lines}      */     void hoo() {     } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:3: Summary of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:9: Summary of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  **Describe the solution you'd like** The logging approach is not optimized, it directly logs the violation at the start of javadoc comment, the least improvement that can be done is to log violation at the `@summary` tag.  Expected output- ```bash /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:4: Summary of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:10: Summary of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  Additionally, the check currently uses regex in the following method- https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/c9134ce31c4776e4ab6764824bb234bf5495be0e/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/javadoc/SummaryJavadocCheck.java#L435-L446  This should be replaced by the AST approach which was initially discussed in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9993

column3: Add support for `@implNote`, `@implSpec` and `@apiNote`
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  https://checkstyle.org/config_javadoc.html#JavadocType  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                         /var/tmp $ cat Test.java /**  * @apiNote this class exists so that its methods can be used as predicates  * @implNote internally uses the xyz service  * @implSpec don't forget to call super if you override any of the methods in this class  */ class Test {     /**      * @randomTagFdskn hello      */     void test() {     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:2:4: Unknown tag 'apiNote'. [JavadocType] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:3:4: Unknown tag 'implNote'. [JavadocType] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:4:4: Unknown tag 'implSpec'. [JavadocType] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Since Java 8, Javadocs may *unofficially* contain `@implNote`, `@implSpec` and `@apiNote` tags, as explained in [this article](https://nipafx.dev/javadoc-tags-apiNote-implSpec-implNote/). Even though I wrote *unofficially*, the JDK documentation itself uses such tags, e.g. see the "Implementation notes" [here](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentMap.html#getOrDefault-java.lang.Object-V-). They were added in [JDK-8068562](https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8068562). Android Studio, Intellij IDEA, Eclipse, Netbeans, Sublime Text (& possibly more) **support and suggest them**. Even though they are not officially standard, it is as if they were, see [this Stack Overflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/a/55150289/9481500). Checkstyle rejects them as `Unknown tag 'implNote'. [JavadocType]`. Note that this error only occurs for class javadocs, while for method javadocs even random unknown tags are accepted (see output above).  Some references: -   **Describe the solution you'd like** Since those tags are officially part of the Javadoc standard since Java 8, I think checkstyle should consider them as valid tags. The files that should probably be edited are: - Adding `IMPL_NOTE_LITERAL`, `IMPL_SPEC_LITERAL` and `API_NOTE_LITERAL` to the list at [JavadocLexer.g4:126](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/ec446e4c835dbfd1d86de08ead9bd92021a01487/src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/grammar/javadoc/JavadocLexer.g4#L126) - Adding the same tags to the `isJavadocTag` method at [JavadocParser.g4:32](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/grammar/javadoc/JavadocParser.g4#L32)  ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:8:8: Unknown tag 'randomTagFdskn'. [JavadocType] Audit done. ```  **Additional context** Check out #11455 for a similar issue.

column3: WhitespaceAfter should support `ELLIPSIS` token
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  Check documentation at https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter  **How it works Now:**  ```bash  ➜  javac Test.java ➜  cat config.xml                                                     ➜  cat Test.java   public class Test {     void method1(int...myVarargs) { // expected violation          }     void method2(int... myVarargs) { // ok          } }  ➜  java -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "ELLIPSIS" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:473)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:405)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:332)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:191)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "ELLIPSIS" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:468)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.  ```  However, `WhitespaceAroundCheck` does support `ELLIPSIS`. But, this is not a frequently used style. In fact, the [JLS](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-8.html) specifically mentions that  > Note that the ellipsis (...) is a token unto itself (§3.11). It is possible to put whitespace between it and the type, but this is discouraged as a matter of style.  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** I would expect `...` to be a valid token for `WhitespaceAfterCheck`, and for it to enforce style noted above.  **Describe the solution you'd like**   ```bash [ERROR] Test.java:2:21: '...' is not followed by whitespace. [WhitespaceAfter] ```  **Additional context**  Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11094#discussion_r775249437, WhitespaceAfterCheck does not currently support `ELLIPSIS` token.  `ELLIPSIS` should be a default token for `WhitespaceAfterCheck`. Since we use default module for this check in `checkstyle_checks.xml`, we may find some violations in the project.

column3: FileLength Add ignorePattern Property
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java # Compiles ✅  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                                                     /var/tmp $ cat Test.java /**  * This class would pass with the ignorePattern property, but it  * will fail without it.  */ public class Test {    /**    * A simple hello world method.    **/    void helloWorld() {     // Say hi!     System.out.println("Hello world.");   } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module FileLength - Property 'ignorePattern' does not exist, please check the documentation         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Property 'ignorePattern' does not exist, please check the documentation         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.tryCopyProperty(AutomaticBean.java:227)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:194)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.  ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** No problem with existing functionality.  **Describe the solution you'd like** It would be cool if there was a [FileLength property](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_sizes.html#FileLength_Properties) similar to the ignorePattern [LineLength property](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_sizes.html#LineLength_Properties).  When the `ignorePattern` property is included on the `FileLength` check, it would ignore all lines that match the pattern when counting the lines in a file.  **Additional context** For me (and as suggested in the example) this would be really helpful because it would allow me to ignore Javadocs and comments in my Java classes. I think this would incentivize others on my team to be thorough with their Javadocs and not punish them for writing long Javadocs.

column3: Update google_checks.xml to have the SuppressionCommentFilter and SuppressWarningsHolder modules in the config by default (and by extension, SuppressWarningsFilter)
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac MyClass.java #[[MAKE SURE THERE IS SUCCESSFUL COMPILATION]]  /var/tmp $ cat google_checks.xml ...          ...                                        ...    /var/tmp $ cat MyClass.java class MyClass {   public void aMethod() {   } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c google_checks.xml MyClass.java Starting audit... [WARN] /var/tmp/MyClass.java:2:15: Method name 'aMethod' must match pattern '^[a-z][a-z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$'. [MethodName] Audit done. ```  After using `@SuppressWarnings`   ``` /var/tmp $ cat MyClass.java class MyClass {   @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:methodname")   public void aMethod() {   } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c google_checks.xml MyClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  Using special comments to switch checkstyle off and on:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat MyClass.java class MyClass {   // CHECKSTYLE.OFF: MethodName   public void aMethod() {   }   // CHECKSTYLE.ON: MethodName }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c google_checks.xml MyClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```   **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** No, this is just additional config in `google_checks.xml`.  **Describe the solution you'd like** Add the ability to suppress style checks via annotations and special comments around the code. This will offer users alternatives to suppress checks other than using XML.   **Additional context** Some of these changes have been already adopted by Google https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/java-repo-tools/blob/main/third_party/checkstyle/google_checks.xml   **References** * http://stackoverflow.com/a/22556386/101923 * http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4023185

column3: doc: mention that excludes can be class names
column4: I found it confusing that the `excludes` property only mentioned packages, yet when I specified a package, starred static member imports within that package were not excluded. This change clarifies that the `excludes` property uses packages for starred class imports and class names for starred static member imports.  https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Math.html is a class https://checkstyle.org/config_imports.html#AvoidStarImport we already have example where `exclude` uses not only package (2nd example).  ---  Edit: the requested CLI demonstration of the existing behavior that is merely being documented in this PR:  ``` tniessen@ubuntuserver:~/dev/checkstyle$ javac Test.java  tniessen@ubuntuserver:~/dev/checkstyle$ cat Test.java  import static java.lang.Math.*; // okay, class exclude applies import static java.lang.System.*; // violation, package excludes do not apply import java.io.*; // okay, package exclude applies tniessen@ubuntuserver:~/dev/checkstyle$ cat config.xml                            tniessen@ubuntuserver:~/dev/checkstyle$ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" tniessen@ubuntuserver:~/dev/checkstyle$ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/tniessen/dev/checkstyle/Test.java:2:31: Using the '.*' form of import should be avoided - java.lang.System.*. [AvoidStarImport] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```

column3: Remove some hardcoding of specifics so Checkstyle can be more Extensible
column4: I am tired of Checkstyle limiting itself to mainly Java files. I am looking for checkstyle to support more different type of unique files (XML, Properties, etc..) by extending it at https://github.com/rnveach/checkstyle-extras .  In the process of setting this process up and starting it, it started to become apparent how limited Checkstyle was making itself. Configuration isn't really the issue, as it already supports 3rd party classes. It doesn't mind if a new walker or such is being added. But there are specific other, more newer additions, that is hindering the process and causing conflicts or extra code duplication.  The following (so far) is a list I have identified and looking to have loosen up so Checkstyle can support more. * Checkstyle's copyright on Java only support. ( https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11596 ) * Tests only know `Checker` or `TreeWalker` and need some minor re-working to be able to override for newer "walkers ( https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11603 ) * Sub-modules of a module are not really supported, even though some areas are coded to provide this support ( https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11644 ) * ASTs have no generic interface and implmentation that we have to duplicate utility code between our different types of nodes   * Creating a interface between all ASTs to start a synchronization process of common methods ( https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11617 )   * Add methods like getting type, line and column number, iterating through children, etc.   * Create a commonality for `AstTreeStringPrinter` and possibly out Walker modules . * Suppressions is oddly coded for `Checker` or `TreeWalker` and has no idea of flexibility like configurations do.   * This lead to https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11597 . * XPath is very `TreeWalker` specific and not flexible for other nodes   * Utility class is very strict when it doesn't need to be ( https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11598 )   * XPath will be split between AST specific and generic classes ( https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11617 ) * After all this, common functionality should be `abstract`ed out, to separate core functionality and walker specific functionality. This includes walkers, checks, xpath nodes, events, etc....  I am looking for these areas to change, not functionally, but in a way that makes way for extensibility by either Checkstyle itself or 3rd parties.

column3: Resolve security warning of Saxon-HE for commons-codec usage
column4: https://snyk.io/test/github/checkstyle/checkstyle?targetFile=pom.xml  ``` Information Exposure      Vulnerable module: commons-codec:commons-codec     Introduced through: net.sf.saxon:Saxon-HE@11.3  Detailed paths      Introduced through: checkstyle/checkstyle@checkstyle/checkstyle# 993733357459770ceb6f86874fea3b42698f675d ›  net.sf.saxon:Saxon-HE@11.3 › org.xmlresolver:xmlresolver@4.2.0  › org.apache.httpcomponents:httpclient@4.5.13  › commons-codec:commons-codec@1.11  Overview  [commons-codec:commons-codec](https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec) is a package that  contains simple encoder and decoders for various formats such as Base64 and Hexadecimal.  Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure. When there is no byte array value that can be encoded into a string the Base32 implementation does not reject it,  and instead decodes it into an arbitrary  value which can be re-encoded again using the same implementation. This allows for information  exposure exploits  such as tunneling additional information via seemingly valid base 32 strings. ``` -------  can we try to exclude `org.xmlresolver:xmlresolver` when we import dependency  Saxon-HE ?

column4: https://github.com/preslavmihaylov/todocheck  Right now we have https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/.ci/no_old_refs.sh, but todocheck tool seems more flexible and support multiple issue trackers out of the box.

column3: create Github action that does version bump and update of milestone
column4: https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/blob/master/releasenotes-builder/diagrams.md  top and most botton actions of Maintainer is just a version bump to required version and update Github milestone. we need to have github action that can do this for maintainers. So this will help to avoid manual operation in terminal by maintainers and just trigger Github action with definition of version and it does job.  So in case of release of bug fix (10.3.1) user will do: 1) trigger Githib action to update 10.4-SNAPSHOT to 10.3.1-SNAPSHOT 2) trigger release   3) trigger Githib action to update 10.3.2-SNAPSHOT to 10.4-SNAPSHOT  we need automation for step 1 and 3.

column3: Group pitest profiles logically to reduce time wasted in setting up environment
column4: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/runs/7264372538?check_suite_focus=true 1m run.  if we spend 20 seconds on start/finish . and from 40 secnds of mvn execution, about 10 goes to compilation. So we spend 50% on non-pistest ...... it is time to rethink split of pitest execution and make them to run for ~5 minutes to spedn more on pitest rather then start/finish  _Originally posted by @romani in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11869#issuecomment-1179562479_  Combine logically similar pitest profiles to reduce the time setting up the environment and reduce the time waiting for the runner to pick up the job.

column3: Issue #11720: Kill surviving mutation in FinalLocalVariableCheck related to switch statement
column4: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11720 Hardcoded mutation tested at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11841 ### Diff Reports (From harcoded mutation PR):  - DefaultConfig: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/8a3ffff_2022191625/reports/diff/index.html - validateEnhancedForLoopVariableTrueWithParameterDefWithoutOpenJDK: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/8a3ffff_2022130102/reports/diff/index.html  ### This mutation falls in the category:  The logic was analyzed and a test case was developed.

column3: Issue #11720: Kill surviving mutation in CheckstyleAntTask related to creating logger
column4: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11720 Checkstyle Ant Task documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/anttask.html ### Diff Reports:  N/A ### Rationale:  These mutations were getting killed without any new test case when I `replaced equality check with true`. But the mutations were surviving in the `mutationCoverage` report due to branch optimization. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/40b3384a7f22ef41e434cbe747f0a803d2b2d7a2/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/ant/CheckstyleAntTask.java#L698-L706  After branch optimization changed to- ```java if (toFile != null && useFile) {                                                        final OutputStream infoStream = Files.newOutputStream(toFile.toPath());             defaultLogger =                                                                             new DefaultLogger(infoStream, AutomaticBean.OutputStreamOptions.CLOSE,                      infoStream, AutomaticBean.OutputStreamOptions.NONE);            }                                                                                   else {                                                                              ``` Where there was survival and the missing test case was added. I covered both the mutations in a single PR as they were similar.

column3: Update Checkstyle's Copyright
column4: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/config/java.header#L2 > checkstyle: Checks Java source code for adherence to a set of rules.  While we do primarily do validation against Java code, checkstyle does support other file types. [RegExp`](https://checkstyle.org/config_regexp.html#Regexp) can support any text-based file type and can be used to implement custom rules.  We should reword to: ```` checkstyle: Check Java source code and other text files for adherence to a set of rules. ````

column3: tweet-releasenotes.sh should be able to work on start and finish release names
column4: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/.ci/tweet-releasenotes.sh  1) it is not clear why we demand  `checkForVariable "CS_RELEASE_VERSION"`  and in same time do ``` CS_RELEASE_VERSION="$(getCheckstylePomVersion)" echo CS_RELEASE_VERSION="$CS_RELEASE_VERSION" ```  2) This script should work in two modes: `.ci/tweet-releasenotes.sh` - generation of twit for latest release `.ci/tweet-releasenotes.sh 10.3.2` - generation of twit for release 10.3.2

column3: automate execution by Github action bump-license-year.sh on first day of month
column4: https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#onschedule  First day of 1st month of year: `0 0 1 1 *`  This simple task will let us have experience to update sources from Action, that we will need during release notes update in sources.  We will have such action in all satellite projects, so update will happen in same time in parallel, or we will shift all of them by +1 min after main repo
