column3: MissingJavadocType: Support qualified annotation names
column4: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#MissingJavadocType  I have come across the slight annoyance that I am unable to exclude some annotations from the `MissingJavadocType` check because they are nested within a class. [These](https://github.com/JetBrains/java-annotations/blob/master/common/src/main/java/org/jetbrains/annotations/ApiStatus.java) are the annotations in question. Currently, the only workaround is to import every nested annotation separately instead of just the enclosing class.  Specifically, I would like to exclude annotations such as `@ApiStatus.Internal` from `MissingJavadocType` as follows:  ```xml                        ```  From the [docs](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#MissingJavadocType): > Only short names are allowed, e.g. Generated.  Example affected [file(s)](https://github.com/SourceGrade/Jagr/blob/9843a0e01c019e87a6a2cd3de53782174317f519/grader-api/src/main/java/org/sourcegrade/jagr/api/rubric/Criterion.java)  Checkstyle config [here](https://github.com/SourceGrade/Style/blob/4d4b243b2c3a2c31eeb17d96aef6f43f336ae6a0/src/main/resources/config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml), relevant part [here](https://github.com/SourceGrade/Style/blob/4d4b243b2c3a2c31eeb17d96aef6f43f336ae6a0/src/main/resources/config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml#L334)  Example error: ```bash > Task :jagr-grader-api:checkstyleMain FAILED [ant:checkstyle] [WARN] /home/alex/IdeaProjects/Jagr/grader-api/src/main/java/org/sourcegrade/jagr/api/rubric/Criterion.java:239:5: Missing a Javadoc comment. [MissingJavadocType]  ...  Execution failed for task ':jagr-grader-api:checkstyleMain'. ```  ## Minimal example  https://github.com/alexstaeding/CheckStyle-Issue11736  ```java /**  * Ignore.  */ public interface Foo {      @ApiStatus.Internal     interface A {     }      @Internal     interface B {     } } ```  It is currently not possible to provide a value for skipAnnotations so that this `Foo.A` interface does not require javadoc. This is specifically mentioned in the [docs](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#MissingJavadocType). ```xml   ```  ## CLI (executed in [this](https://github.com/alexstaeding/CheckStyle-Issue11736) repository):  ```bash $ cat config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml                                                                                                  $ cat src/main/java/Foo.java  import org.jetbrains.annotations.ApiStatus; import org.jetbrains.annotations.ApiStatus.Internal;  /**  * Ignore.  */ public interface Foo {      @ApiStatus.Internal     interface A {      }      @Internal     interface B {      } }  java -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml src/main/java/Foo.java Starting audit... [ERROR] ***/IdeaProjects/CheckStyle-Issue11736/src/main/java/Foo.java:9:5: Missing a Javadoc comment. [MissingJavadocType] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```

column3: WhitespaceAfter should support LITERAL_YIELD token
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter  I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac WithYield.java /var/tmp $  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                              /var/tmp $ cat WithYield.java public class WithYield {     public static void main(String[] args) {         int a = switch (args[0]) {             case "got":                 yield 1;             case "my":                 yield(3);             default:                 yield 2;         };         System.out.println(a);     } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml WithYield.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "LITERAL_YIELD" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "LITERAL_YIELD" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** It would be nice if checkstyle could detect missing space after `yield` keyword.  **Describe the solution you'd like** WhitespaceAfter could support new literal type - `LITERAL_YIELD`  #11489, #11493 and #11494 are similar requests for `try`/`finally`/`synchronized` keywords support

column3: WhitespaceAfter should support LITERAL_TRY token
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter  I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac TryStatement.java /var/tmp $  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                              /var/tmp $ cat TryStatement.java import java.io.IOException; import java.io.InputStream;  public class TryStatement {     public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {         try(InputStream ignored = System.in) {          }     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml TryStatement.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "LITERAL_TRY" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "LITERAL_TRY" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** It would be nice if checkstyle could detect missing space after `try` keyword.  **Describe the solution you'd like** WhitespaceAfter could support new literal type - `LITERAL_TRY`  **Additional context** Google Java Style Guide requires whitespace separation of `(` from any reserved words See https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.6.2-horizontal-whitespace >1. Separating any reserved word, such as `if`, `for` or `catch`, from an open parenthesis (`(`) that follows it on that line  #8122 seems related. This feature request is part of it.

column3: WhitespaceAfter should support LITERAL_FINALLY token
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter  I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac FinallyStatement.java /var/tmp $  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                              /var/tmp $ cat FinallyStatement.java public class FinallyStatement {     public static void main(String[] args) {         try {             System.out.println(Integer.parseInt(args[0]));         } finally{             System.out.println("Finished");         }     } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml FinallyStatement.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "LITERAL_FINALLY" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "LITERAL_FINALLY" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** It would be nice if checkstyle could detect missing space after `finally` keyword.  **Describe the solution you'd like** WhitespaceAfter could support new literal type - `LITERAL_FINALLY`  **Additional context** Google Java Style Guide requires whitespace before _almost_ any `{` usage. See https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.6.2-horizontal-whitespace >3. Before any open curly brace (`{`), with two exceptions: > `@SomeAnnotation({a, b})` (no space is used) > `String[][] x = {{"foo"}};` (no space is required between `{{`, by item 9 below)  #8122 seems related. This feature request is part of it.  #11489 is similar request for `try` keyword support

column3: WhitespaceAfter should support LITERAL_CATCH token
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter  I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac CatchSpace.java /var/tmp $  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                              /var/tmp $ cat CatchSpace.java public class CatchSpace {     public static void main(String[] args) {         try {             Integer.parseInt(args[0]);         } catch(NumberFormatException e) {             System.out.println("not a number");         }     } }   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml CatchSpace.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "LITERAL_CATCH" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "LITERAL_CATCH" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)         ... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** It would be nice if checkstyle could detect missing space after `catch` keyword.  **Describe the solution you'd like** WhitespaceAfter could support new literal type - `LITERAL_CATCH`  **Additional context** Google Java Style Guide requires whitespace separation of `(` from any reserved words See https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.6.2-horizontal-whitespace >1. Separating any reserved word, such as `if`, `for` or `catch`, from an open parenthesis (`(`) that follows it on that line  #11489, #11493 and #11494 are similar requests for `try`/`finally`/`synchronized` keywords support

column3: Update doc for MethodLength
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_sizes.html#MethodLength  Add example for each existing config to show what code is ok and what code cause violation.  A good example is https://checkstyle.org/config_naming.html#AbstractClassName.  Look at referenced commits of https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/5832, to see what and how should be changed in code.  Please play with module/check by means of https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html to understand how it works.  PLEASE READ https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-update-examples

column3: First example of AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters is wrong
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters says "OK" for control characters in the first example. That's wrong, since the default for that flag is false. See line 3 of the below code block.  ``` String unitAbbrev = "μs";     // OK, perfectly clear even without a comment. String unitAbbrev = "\u03bcs";// violation, the reader has no idea what this is. return '\ufeff' + content;    // OK, an example of non-printable,                               // control characters (byte order mark). ``` In fact, the second example then shows changing the flag, but has the same OK/violations outcome like the first example, clearly showing a contradiction here.

column3: WriteTag reports violation with confusing message when there is no javadoc
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_javadoc.html#WriteTag ``` $ cat Test.java public class Test {}  $ cat config.xml                         $ java -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\workdir\Test.java:1: Type Javadoc comment is missing null tag. [WriteTag] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  Expected: no violation, since there is no javadoc. Also note confusing violation message ("null" tag).  For javadoc presence there are other checks. And docs mention that with default config it does nothing, but it reports weird message instead.  P.S. Checkstyle has `WriteTag` with default config -  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/4ad253653d59d77002ae2f61349624dcb18dcc38/config/checkstyle_checks.xml#L653

column3: Update doc for SuppressWithPlainTextCommentFilter
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_filters.html#SuppressWithPlainTextCommentFilter_Properties ![Screenshot 2022-01-16 025133](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80591258/149638117-c58a2178-4182-4e6c-a5d4-ef209db9b116.png) Notes section should be placed before the properties section As we can see in the image above, the notes section is after the properties section, unlike other filters on the same page. like: ![Screenshot 2022-01-16 030726](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80591258/149638502-eb6ab34d-f51b-4326-839c-5f06368ba6fc.png) & ![Screenshot 2022-01-16 030743](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80591258/149638506-e8d5cbf3-6b56-4134-b462-4285cb9de086.png)   files need to be updated in this case: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/xdocs/config_filters.xml https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/filters/SuppressWithPlainTextCommentFilter.java

column3: UnnecessaryParentheses: false negative on unnecessary parenthesis
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#UnnecessaryParentheses  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     public static boolean is(Class clazz) {         return true             && (test(clazz)); // no violation     }      public static boolean test(Class clazz) {         return true;     } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                        $ java -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ````  Expected a violation on line 4.  PMD reported the violation.

column3: UnnecessaryParentheses: false negative
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#UnnecessaryParentheses  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {      public boolean isUsed() {         return used                 || (this.filePattern != null && this.filePattern.trim().length() == 0 // line 4                 || this.messagePattern != null && this.messagePattern.trim().length() == 0                 || this.checkPattern != null && this.checkPattern.trim().length() == 0);      } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                        $ java -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ````  I am expecting a violation on line 4 since the code equates to the same without the parenthesis as with.  Proof: ```` public class BooleanTest {  	public static void main(String[] args) { 		for (boolean a : new boolean[] { true, false }) { 			for (boolean b : new boolean[] { true, false }) { 				for (boolean c : new boolean[] { true, false }) { 					for (boolean d : new boolean[] { true, false }) { 						for (boolean e : new boolean[] { true, false }) { 							final boolean one = a || (b && c || d && e); 							final boolean two = a || b && c || d && e;  							if (one != two) { 								throw new IllegalStateException(a + ", " + b + ", " + c + ", " + d + ", " + e); 							} 						} 					} 				} 			} 		}  		System.out.println("Yes"); 	}  }  Outputs: "Yes" ````

column3: Allow SuppressWarningHolder to suppress the violation with NameCheck
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_annotation.html#SuppressWarningsHolder From the issue https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11542#discussion_r916360657  ``` $ cat Test.java class Test {    private static final int i = 0;    @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:constantnamecheck")   private static final int m = 0; }   $ cat config.xml    	                    	         $ java -jar /home/kevin/Downloads/checkstyle-10.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/kevin/Desktop/C_Style/Test.java:3:28: Name 'i' must match pattern '^[A-Z][A-Z0-9]*(_[A-Z0-9]+)*$'. [ConstantName] [ERROR] /home/kevin/Desktop/C_Style/Test.java:6:28: Name 'm' must match pattern '^[A-Z][A-Z0-9]*(_[A-Z0-9]+)*$'. [ConstantName] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ``` Expected no violation at line no:-6  as we are using ```@SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:constantnamecheck")```  **Attention**:  documentation must be updated to mention in words that this is possible, not example is reqired (as it is rarely used names, in all docs all names are without Check).

column3: SuppressWarningsHolder should allow usage of simple name of Checks in aliasList
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_annotation.html#SuppressWarningsHolder  ``` $ cat Test.java class Test {   @SuppressWarnings("paramnum")   public void needsLotsOfParameters( int a,    int b, int c, int d, int e, int f, int g, int h) {     // ...   } }  $ cat config.xml    	 	                                          $ java -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/kevin/Desktop/C_Style/Test.java:4:15: More than 7 parameters (found 8). [ParameterNumber] Audit done. ```  Expected: no violation.  workaround is to use fully qualified name of Check. see details - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11542#issuecomment-1126821468

column4: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/13219/workflows/1146374b-20d7-4c92-aaae-b55e058c93cc/jobs/140789  ``` CheckstyleException: Exception was thrown while processing  /root/project/.ci-temp/contribution/checkstyle-tester/src/main/java/ spoon/src/test/resources/ annotated-parameter-on-nested-class-constructor/Caller.java    .....  Caused by: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: begin 0, end -1, length 9     at java.lang.String.checkBoundsBeginEnd (String.java:3319)     at java.lang.String.substring (String.java:1874)     at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.RedundantImportCheck.isFromPackage (RedundantImportCheck.java:185)     at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.RedundantImportCheck.visitToken (RedundantImportCheck.java:147)     at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.notifyVisit (TreeWalker.java:335) ```  Expected: no exception

column3: Support .editorconfig format configuration
column4: http://editorconfig.org/ is becoming somewhat of a standard?  Support for using .editorconfig configuration file for the formatting would be great.

column3: infra: update permissions for rebase workflow
column4: Hopefully fixes failure of `Github, rebase` workflow.  It was tough to find exact documentation that details which permission is necessary for this action, [this](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/pulls#merge-a-pull-request) is somewhat related. Repo for [cirrus actions rebase ](https://github.com/cirrus-actions/rebase) does not specify exact permissions required for it's workflow, but there is an issue at https://github.com/cirrus-actions/rebase/issues/84#issuecomment-984248665 that states that the changes in this PR are required.

column3: infra: Update commands used for validation with Hibernate Search
column4: Hibernate Search changed the name of its Maven property controlling the version of checkstyle, so the previous commands did not actually override the version of checkstyle.  Fortunately we upgrade checkstyle regularly in Hibernate Search (e.g. https://github.com/hibernate/hibernate-search/pull/2874), so we know it still works.

column3: A new test case created for BlockTagUtil. Thanks for your review and consideration
column4: Hi, there. I wrote a small update for adding a new test case for  ExtractBlockTags in BlockTagUtil. Followed the contribution document, and changes are passed by command mvn clean verify. Thank you for your review and consideration.

column3: Is Checkstyle plugin for Sonarqube affected by Spring4Shell vulnerability (CVE-2022-22965)
column4: Hi, We are using Checkstyle plugin (v9.2) for Sonarqube EE (v9.2.4) but we would need your confirmation whether Checkstyle plugin has got any impact due to security vulnerability - CVE-2022-22965 (Spring4Shell)?  Regards, @shafemoh

column3: minor: add new character switch test case in FallThroughCheck
column4: Hi, This is a small update for adding a new test case for the character switch case in FallThroughCheck. Followed the contribution document, and changes are passed by command `mvn clean verify`. Thank you for your review and consideration.

column3: There are semantic problems in the Chinese error message of keyword `design.forExtension` .
column4: Here is the error report:  ```bash [ERROR] XXX.java:[15,1] (design) DesignForExtension: 類 'XXX' 看起來像是為擴展設計的（可以是子類），但方法 'badmethod' 沒有javadoc，解釋瞭如何安全地執行。如果類不是為擴展而設計的，請考慮創建類 'Application' final或使方法 'badmethod' static/final/abstract/empty，或為方法添加允許的 ```  ---  There are semantic problems in the error message above. And it's in Traditional Chinese, not Simplified Chinese like the rest messages in file `messages_zh.properties`   This error message cloud be better: ` 方法 {} 可被子类重写且不是抽象方法或空方法，应为其添加 javadoc 说明，或将类 {} 设置为不可继承。`  ---

column3: False Negative: SummaryJavadocCheck
column4: have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#SummaryJavadoc I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```xml                        ``` ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java /**  * This is 1 version  */ public class Test { }  /**  * This is 1.0 version  */ class Test2 { } ``` ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:1: First sentence of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:1: First sentence of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:7: First sentence of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  The `.` in `1.0` is falsely considered as the ending period which causes this bug.

column3: SummaryJavadocCheck not able to recognize summary inside HTML tags.
column4: have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#SummaryJavadoc I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ``` ```xml                        ``` ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java ``` ```java /**  *   *   This is the summary.  *   */ public class Test { } ``` ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:1: Summary javadoc is missing. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.0-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  The summary is present but still, it shows an error. ![Screenshot from 2022-03-17 22-41-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73882557/158856426-6dad17cf-b04d-485c-9ef2-cbe4ba38c454.png)

column3: Calculate and compare the pitest execution time after including CDG accelerator plugin.
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11869#issuecomment-1179587293  The execution time of pitest has reduced after including the CDG accelerator plugin see detailed report at #11869.   The task of this PR is to calculate the execution time of pitest alone (without setting up the environment in Github actions) and give that report to the maintainers of the plugin.  To calculate the time, create a `pitest-all` profile in local (with all classes present in all the different profiles). Run mutation coverage without the CDG accelerator plugin, and save the log (basically, the time elapsed).  Now run the same profile with the plugin, compare the diff, and report. If the mutation coverage does not take a lot of time (last time we tried the `pitest-all` profile, it took 12 hrs) make a PR, with that profile in a Github action.

column3: Links to older versions of Checkstyle release notes should have simple direct link
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11749/files#r901140140: >`https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/version/6.18/: 403 Forbidden`  failure is stable, several executions fails in row.  on section: ```xml                     Current site contains documentation only for latest, released version.         We only support this latest version. We highly recommend read latest documentation first.                  However, you might need documentation for previous releases because you are still using         an older version and latest version describe some features that does not work for you.                  You can find documentation for most old versions using a URL format like         https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/version/X.X where "X.X" is the version number.         Example:                    https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/version/6.18                  for version 6.18.               ``` Old link from current documentation about release notes:   https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/version/6.18  New link to current checkstyle.org site:  https://checkstyle.org/releasenotes_old_6-0_7-8.html#Release_6.18   In previous documentation about finding release notes of older versions, it was easy to understand ` https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/version/X.X where "X.X" is the version number.`   Now, we would need to say something like: `https://checkstyle.org/releasenotes_old__.html#Release_, where starting and ending release must be hyphenated major-minor version, in one of two ranges (if your version is less than 7.9): 6-0_7-8 OR 5.9_1.0, and actual release number is in the form of major.minor.patch (if patch is applicable).`  This is complicated and more confusing than just scrolling to the bottom of the release notes and clicking on the link to older versions, see right below https://checkstyle.org/releasenotes.html#Release_8.0  We should either completely remove this entire `Previous Version Documentation` section, or overhaul how we directly link to older releases.

column3: Enforce file size on Java inputs
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11156#pullrequestreview-845293639  We need to get statistics on how long our Input files and get median value and enforce file size to not above this value.  All suppressions can be resolved in separate PRs for each Check individually.  Rationale: big input files a hard to review, hard to debug.   All existing inputs are moved to suppression at 3b523bd https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/b37ec9ce2c37473b248d547b17aa0fb15b481624/config/checkstyle_resources_suppressions.xml#L174 Now we need to update all that inputs to follow limit 120 and remove related suppressions. Each Check inputs should be in separate Pull Request  Example of update: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/commit/58a0b13a48d1afb4b3d599d2dcff6ba588c8ba66  If test method is testJavadocStyleFirstSentenceOne make input file named  InputJavadocStyleFirstSentenceOne.java

column3: Move methods common in UnusedLocalVariableCheck and FinalClassCheck to util
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10930#discussion_r785397301 To be addressed after merging #10930  UnusedLocalVariableCheck (#10930) and FinalClassCheck (Check +  #10968) has some methods in common-  ``` - extractQualifiedName(..) - classNameMatchingCount(..) - getQualifiedClassOrInterfaceName(DetailAST classAst) (known as `getQualifiedClassName` in final class) - getQualifiedClassOrInterfaceName(String packageName, String outerClassQualifiedName, String className) (known as `getQualifiedClassName` in final class) ``` Also FinalClassCheck and UnusedLocalVariableCheck have a static nested class in common - `ClassDesc`. We may merge both of these classes and extract it somewhere, there are some overlapping properties.  When #10968 will be merged, extract these methods to util and try to remove the suppression for `ExcessiveClassLength` in UnusedLocalVariableCheck.

column3: Wrap `assertThrows` with `getExpectedThrowable` method.
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11315#issuecomment-1049494653:  > ATTENTION: I do not know why, but my brain do not not reading `assertThrows` properly. as it should be named `expectThrows` and assert on it done in separate block of code. should we create util method in our repo? to wrap/re-call `assertThrows`. To just have different name of method that is more logical to my mind. >  > code will looks like: >  > ``` >     public void testMethodGood() { >  >         int[] arr = new int[]{}; >         final IndexOutOfBoundsException exception = >                 expectThrows(IndexOutOfBoundsException.class, >                         () -> { >                             int i = arr[2]; >                         }); >  >         assertWithMessage("Invalid error message") >                 .that(exception.getMessage()) >                 .isEqualTo("Index 2 out of bounds for length 0"); >  >     } > ```  In the scope of this issue, we should:  1. Create `getExpectedThrowable`method in TestUtils 2. Restrict import of `Assertions#assertThrows` to TestUtils only 3. Fix all violations in project. 4. Update`MatchXPath` module introduced in #11315   We can consider using new feature mentioned at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11995#pullrequestreview-1051882798

column3: False positive: SummaryJavadocCheck
column4: From [comment1](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11051/files#r775167621) and [comment2](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11051/files#r775200466) I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#SummaryJavadoc I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Test2.java  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                         /var/tmp $ cat Test2.java // unexpected violation below /**  * This is the actual summary.  * {@summary This is wrong usage}  */ public class Test2 { }  // expected violation below /**  * This is summary  */ class foo { }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test2.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/vyom/IdeaProjects/ConfigCheckstyle/src/TestP/Test2.java:2: Summary of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] [ERROR] /home/vyom/IdeaProjects/ConfigCheckstyle/src/TestP/Test2.java:10: First sentence of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ``` ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.** ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/vyom/IdeaProjects/ConfigCheckstyle/src/TestP/Test2.java:10: First sentence of Javadoc is missing an ending period. [SummaryJavadoc] Audit done. ```  If the first line is present then `@summary` is ignored, though a warning is given by the Javadoc tool. ``` Test.java:4: warning: invalid use of @summary      * {@summary This is wrong usage} ``` see all details at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11051#discussion_r775167621  Expected: only violation on second javadoc

column3: New filter: Suppress checks with inline comments on different file types
column4: From #11884 ## Description The filter should work exactly like [SuppressWithNearbyCommentFilter](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_filters.html#SuppressWithNearbyCommentFilter). The only difference is that it should be able to filter different file types(i.e. have `Checker` as parent module instead of `TreeWalker`) - `java`, `xml`, `js`, `properties`, `sql`, etc. It shoud have the following properties:  | Name      | Description | Default value | | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | | `commentFormat` | Specify comment pattern to trigger filter to begin suppression. | "SUPPRESS CHECKSTYLE (\w+)" | | `checkFormat` | Specify check pattern to suppress. | ".*" | | `messageFormat` | Define message pattern to suppress. | null | | `idFormat` | Specify check ID pattern to suppress. | null | | `influenceFormat` | Specify negative/zero/positive value that defines the number of lines preceding/at/following the suppression comment. | "0" |  ## How it should work This is just an example config with 3 files to show what is expected. Configuration of properties should be the same as the above mentioned filter. Their behaviour is well-documented there. ### Config ```xml          	      	                                           ``` ### XML ```xml   // ok  // violation ``` #### Expected output ```bash $ java -jar checkstyle-all.jar -c config.xml file.xml [ERROR] file.xml:3:0: Line is longer than 2 characters (found 16). [LineLength] ``` ### SQL ```sql SELECT COUNT(1) FROM filters; -- SUPPRESS CHECKSTYLE LineLengthCheck // ok SELECT COUNT(1) FROM checks; // violation ``` #### Expected output ```bash $ java -jar checkstyle-all.jar -c config.xml file.sql [ERROR] file.sql:2:0: Line is longer than 2 characters (found 28). [LineLength] ``` ### Java ```java int a = 5; // SUPPRESS CHECKSTYLE LineLengthCheck // ok int b = 3; // violation ``` #### Expected output ```bash $ java -jar checkstyle-all.jar -c config.xml file.java [ERROR] file.java:2:0: Line is longer than 2 characters (found 10). [LineLength] ```  ---  ### Config with `influenceFormat` ```xml          	                     	                                           ``` ### XML ```xml   // ok  // ok  //ok  // violation ``` --- An aggreement on name needs to be made. For the demo purpose I just called it `NewFilter`.

      37: pop       38: getstatic     #21                 // Field NAME_TO_FULL_MODULE_NAME:Ljava/util/Map;       41: ldc           #41                 // String LeftCurlyCheck       43: ldc           #43                 // String com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.blocks.LeftCurlyCheck       45: invokeinterface #35,  3           // InterfaceMethod java/util/Map.put:(Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;       50: pop       51: getstatic     #21                 // Field NAME_TO_FULL_MODULE_NAME:Ljava/util/Map;       54: ldc           #45                 // String NeedBracesCheck       56: ldc           #47                 // String com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.blocks.NeedBracesCheck       58: invokeinterface #35,  3           // InterfaceMethod java/util/Map.put:(Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;       63: pop       64: getstatic     #21                 // Field NAME_TO_FULL_MODULE_NAME:Ljava/util/Map;       67: ldc           #49                 // String RightCurlyCheck       69: ldc           #51                 // String com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.blocks.RightCurlyCheck       71: invokeinterface #35,  3           // InterfaceMethod java/util/Map.put:(Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;       76: pop       77: return     LineNumberTable:       line 309: 0       line 311: 12       line 313: 25       line 315: 38       line 317: 51       line 319: 64       line 321: 77    static {};     Code:        0: new           #54                 // class java/util/HashMap        3: dup        4: invokespecial #55                 // Method java/util/HashMap."":()V        7: putstatic     #21                 // Field NAME_TO_FULL_MODULE_NAME:Ljava/util/Map;       10: return     LineNumberTable:       line 305: 0 } ```  When I generated pit report with only `PackageObjectFactoryTest#testNameToFullModuleNameMap()`, the mutations under discussion were killed (https://vyom-yadav.github.io/pitest-all-latest/pitest-common-modified/index.html)   From discord discussion: >Static initializers and other code that is only run once per JVM (such as code in enum constructors) cause a bit of a problem. The only test to execute a static initializer will be the first test to run that causes that class to load code in static initializer blocks is not re-run so the mutants have no effect. Pitest tries to avoid mutating static initializer code It will not create mutants in static initializers private methods called only from static initializers can also result in small differences between runs.  Issue in pitest opened at https://github.com/hcoles/pitest/issues/1066

column3: Issue #7688: update doc for RedundantImport
column4: Fixes #7688 ![ayy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78761614/146316285-62ca8157-1d5e-4be8-8d1b-03eced6c9a1d.png)  **Default examples:** ``` $ cat config.xml                         $ cat MyClass.java package Test; import static Test.MyClass.*; // OK, static import import static java.lang.Integer.MAX_VALUE; // OK, static import  import Test.MyClass; // violation, imported from the same package as the current package import java.lang.String; // violation, the class imported is from the 'java.lang' package import java.util.Scanner; // OK import java.util.Scanner; // violation, it is a duplicate of another import public class MyClass{ };  $ java -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c config.xml MyClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\Users\Dell\Desktop\Checkstyle\Test\MyClass.java:5:1: Redundant import from the same package - Test.MyClass. [RedundantImport] [ERROR] C:\Users\Dell\Desktop\Checkstyle\Test\MyClass.java:6:1: Redundant import from the java.lang package - java.lang.String. [RedundantImport] [ERROR] C:\Users\Dell\Desktop\Checkstyle\Test\MyClass.java:8:1: Duplicate import to line 7 - java.util.Scanner. [RedundantImport] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors.    ```

I fixed this issue by adding a method to dertermine whether the node is in an anonymous object. Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/as23415672/b6efc853253765e2c3ff2ae12f77b6a5/raw/2610c9ad3fe1b3c1213896f23816169f81d11755/my_check_ClassMemberImpliedModifier.xml

column3: Pitest: Create robust method of surviving mutation suppression
column4: Example of current Pitest script output upon failure:  ``` Actual: ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java.html:        contextStack.clear(); Ignore:  Diff: --- target/ignored.txt  2022-05-22 09:49:25.619294919 -0400 +++ target/actual.txt   2022-05-22 09:49:25.615961595 -0400 @@ -0,0 +1 @@ +ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java.html:        contextStack.clear(); Difference between 'Actual' and 'Ignore' lists is detected, lists should be equal. build will be failed.   ```  There are several important pieces of information missing from this output:  1. Line number 2. Type of mutation operator 3. Exact mutation applied  As it stands now, our surviving mutation suppression model for Pitest has some limitations:  1. It forces maintainer to go to report to find details 2. Allows suppression of multiple mutators in a single line  -------------------------------  I would like output more like this:  ``` ➜  checkstyle git:(master) ✗ kotlinc ./.ci/pitest.kt pitest-sizes  Surviving mutation found. Source File: "ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java" Class: "com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheck" Method: "isContainerNode" Line Number: 232 Line Contents: "return TokenUtil.isOfType(node, TokenTypes.METHOD_DEF" Mutator: org.pitest.mutationtest.engine.gregor.mutators.ReturnValsMutator Description: "replaced return of integer sized value with (x == 0 ? 1 : 0)"  ```  This will make it easier for maintainers working on pitest issues to find exact mutation to hardcode and run diff report against. There would be no need to view the pitest report.  ------------------------------ I propose that we use kotlin or groovy (executed as a script) to create this suppression system, using the following high-level implementation:  1. Parse pitest XML report generated by pitest execution. We can pass exact maven pitest execution in as command line args to script. 2. Generate a POJO from each `mutation` node. This POJO should have an optional `source` field that will contain the line of source code that is being mutated (similar to existing solution). 3. Create a collection of all generated POJOs. 4. Remove killed mutations from collection. 5. Compare surviving mutations to existing collection of survivors, these can also be parsed from a set of existing custom XML reports from the initial run (these are checked into Github). We will need to create some form of "fuzzy equals" to determine if we have a match between collections. 6. Print diff to command line, in format proposed above.  This tool should have a way to print out mutation POJOs to a file as XML as our "suppression" list (see item 5 above) .  To achieve feature parity with current implementation, we should also have a "flaky survivor" collection.  Example of XML report:  ```  ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheck isContainerNode (Lcom/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/DetailAST;)Z 232 org.pitest.mutationtest.engine.gregor.mutators.ReturnValsMutator 31 1 com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheckTest.[engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheckTest]/[method:testVisitTokenWithWrongTokenType()] replaced return of integer sized value with (x == 0 ? 1 : 0)    ```  This system has the advantage of not requiring maintainers to look at the reports at all; all relevant information is shown on the command line or in CI. This will speed up the mutation killing process since we will have many to deal with soon.   ---------------------- Comparison between surviving mutations is based on how we define `equals()` in our `Mutation` POJO. We cannot use line/ column number for equals, as this may shift around.  I propose we define `equals()` as the following properties being the same:  1. Source file 2. Mutated class 3. Mutated Method 4. Mutator 5. Block (this is block of instructions, roughly each `{}`) 6. Description 8. Line Contents  This may not be enough information to differentiate between mutations, however. We may need to do use the HTML report to generate POJOs and get the exact line of code from the source file OR get file contents/ exact line in script.

column3: ConfigurationLoader needs to share context of execution during exception wrap
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11701/files  ``` catch (final CheckstyleException ex) {     // -@cs[IllegalInstantiation] SAXException is in the overriden     // method signature     throw new SAXException(ex); } ```  should be something like: ``` catch (final CheckstyleException ex) {     // -@cs[IllegalInstantiation] SAXException is in the overridden     // method signature     throw new SAXException("Exception during replacing values in property " + attributes.getValue(VALUE), ex); }  ```  Rationale: we need to share context of execution during exception wrap. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/org/xml/sax/SAXException.html#SAXException(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.Exception)

column3: Extend TokenUtils.isOfType with more overloaded method improve performance
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11371#discussion_r830507927  apply patch: ``` diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java index 9dd5c13..a5ff490 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java @@ -291,7 +291,23 @@ public final class TokenUtil {          return matching;      }   -    /** +    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first) { +        return type == first; +    } + +    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first, int second) { +        return type == first || type == second; +    } + +    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first, int second, int third) { +        return type == first || type == second || type == third; +    } + +    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first, int second, int third, int forth) { +        return type == first || type == second || type == third || type == forth; +    } + +   /**       * Determines if the AST belongs to the given types.       *       * @param ast the AST node to check @@ -303,6 +319,22 @@ public final class TokenUtil {          return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), types);      }   +    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first) { +        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first); +    } + +    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first, int second) { +        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first, second); +    } + +    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first, int second, int third) { +        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first,second, third); +    } + +    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first, int second, int third, int forth) { +        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first,second, third, forth); +    } +      /**       * Determines if given AST is a root node, i.e. if the type       * of the token we are checking is {@code COMPILATION_UNIT}. ```  fix coverage: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/162578258-2b335a39-a042-49cc-b068-d7324f13671c.png)

column3: update code base to have javadoc tag to explain noinspection tag content
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11206#discussion_r797996787  code: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/d4228cc1c04f6e18392948986b605cf87738c951/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java#L628-L635  has problems that such technical excuse of to suppress IDEA inspection is rendered in final javadoc and can confuse users. we try to keep reasons of suppressions but in same time we do not want to expose it to users.  proposed solution is too use custom tag for this: ``` $ git diff diff --git a/pom.xml b/pom.xml index 31c2853..65fddda 100644 --- a/pom.xml +++ b/pom.xml @@ -433,6 +433,10 @@                  noinspection                  X                 +               +                noinspectionreason +                X +                                                   diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java index fec6cbd..f216a44 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java @@ -627,8 +627,10 @@ public final class Main {            /**           * The checker threads number. -         * Suppression: CanBeFinal - we use picocli and it use  reflection to manage such fields -         * This option has been skipped for CLI options intentionally. +         * +         * @noinspectionreason CanBeFinal - we use picocli and it use +         *     reflection to manage such fields +         *     This option has been skipped for CLI options intentionally.           *           * @noinspection CanBeFinal           */ diff --git a/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml b/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml index de97b29..35a1ab0 100644 --- a/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml +++ b/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml @@ -2797,7 +2797,7 @@                   -     +              ```

column3: Remove deprecated api method FileContents::inPackageInfo from code
column4: deprecafed in 10.2 (april 2022) https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/commit/f6a15cfb3c3c64d16c269bd8240722c7f9d7974e#diff-0910ced16436543c1477e7a3528483b46612a86971ff771893e89700f85dfb3dR335  deprecation issue - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/11507  We need to find some major version update time,  and remove such methods from our API. column3: Add icon to the GUI window
column4: Currently, the default Java application icon is used in the GUI window. This makes it difficult to use. We have an icon image for the site `favicon`. It is possible to reuse this icon for GUI.

column3: Update `bump-license-year.sh` to use `g4` file extension.
column4: Currently, file name pattern in `find` only specifies `*.g`, which is ANTLR2 file extension:  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/51159e3f1219622b9b45e827976912f0dd6c8b25/.ci/bump-license-year.sh#L12   We need to update this to find ANTLR4 files (*.g4) to bump license year, and manually run workflow to send PR for license year bump to show that it works.  ``` ➜  grep -R "2001-202" | grep -v "2001-2022\|target" src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/grammar/java/JavaLanguageParser.g4:// Copyright (C) 2001-2021 the original author or authors. src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/grammar/java/JavaLanguageLexer.g4:// Copyright (C) 2001-2021 the original author or authors. src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/header/header/InputHeaderjava3.header://testvdfv Copyright (C) 2001-2020 the original author or authors.   ```

column3: Sarif support is not extended onto the Ant task defined.
column4: Current version of Ant Task is not being extended to generate sarif report. I have created an ant project and tried to create a sarif output format.  **How it works Now:**  adding formatter type to sarif should generate the sarif file in reports like it does for xml. But this formatter type is not supported. Sample snippet: ```xml              ...                                                      ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** It is related to a feature added in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9671  **Describe the solution you'd like** added the sarif logger like we have added xml logger to generate report in `src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/ant/CheckstyleAntTask.java`

column3: Fix methods for package-info file check
column4: Current implementation of FileContents looks like https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/5df2e3fdceabef4c8d269bac18e982ad11f4779d/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/FileContents.java#L332-L334  It will return true on inputs like `some-package-info.java`  It should be fixed. Also after https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11502 replacement method CheckUtil#isPackageInfo should be fixed as well.

column3: Improve code coverage for GUI classes
column4: Current coverage:  | Class | Coverage | | :------- | :-----------: | | BaseCellEditor | 8% | | TreeTable.TreeTableCellEditor | 8% | | TreeTableCellRenderer | 35% | | TreeTable | 89% |  | ListToTreeSelectionModelWrapper | 63% | | ParseTreeTableModel | 80% | | TreeTableModelAdapter | 56% | | CodeSelector | 80% |  | TreeTableModelAdapter.UpdatingTreeModelListener | 60% |  The goal is 100% code coverage.  ## Notes  It is possible to run GUI from IDE and collect the coverage report: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900805/161822092-6d68c940-c7b1-4dfe-9f9a-03e43c529b3a.png)  Some code may be unreachable from any user input (mouse, keyboard, changing system properties and so on). Such code should be considered as "dead" code and should be deleted.  Before deleting any code, make sure that it is not executed in Windows, Mac & Linux.  Please send one PR per class. Use existing GUI tests from the package `com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.gui` for reference.

column3: Automate creation of settings.xml file for release
column4: create shell file that create settings.xml that we will use for release based on few environment variables which contains passwords.  CI will store in environemnt variables passwords and other secret values. we need create file that is ready for use by maven. So shell script should create a file.  if settings.xml file exists with different content, do backup of such file as `settings.xml.back`.

column3: Rework IT's Test Structure
column4: Continuing on https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11603 and https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11585 ,  Google and Sun IT's tests follow a different pattern than XPath and Test. Because of this, both test areas should change their test make up based on their respective testing pattern.  This is planned to be test/it only changes, nothing in `main` will change. It also will be a multi-PR work (4 PRs are planned).  =============  Examples:  Google and Sun does regression on an existing configuration. They do not create modules from memory or scan existing modules. Their methods should revolve around this. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/74747a21f4e1e1a9fa8495879bf85f058b7d9ba1/src/it/java/com/google/checkstyle/test/base/AbstractGoogleModuleTestSupport.java#L41 https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/74747a21f4e1e1a9fa8495879bf85f058b7d9ba1/src/it/java/com/google/checkstyle/test/base/AbstractGoogleModuleTestSupport.java#L52 We should remove reliance on `ModuleCreationOption` and rework the code to know the hierarchy similar to test as we follow the configuration file. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/74747a21f4e1e1a9fa8495879bf85f058b7d9ba1/src/it/java/org/checkstyle/base/AbstractItModuleTestSupport.java#L58 In addition, their tests will need changes related to the changing result of the `getModule` methods which will return multiple, nested configs. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/74747a21f4e1e1a9fa8495879bf85f058b7d9ba1/src/it/java/com/google/checkstyle/test/chapter4formatting/rule462horizontalwhitespace/GenericWhitespaceTest.java#L42 https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/74747a21f4e1e1a9fa8495879bf85f058b7d9ba1/src/it/java/com/google/checkstyle/test/chapter5naming/rule528typevariablenames/RecordTypeParameterNameTest.java#L41  XPath's regression very closely follow's test, so it should extend test's structure.  Similar changes to IT and XPath should be copied over to test like usual.

column3: Performance Issue with Javadoc Grammar
column4: Consider a simple javadoc (no tags, inline tags, HTML elements, etc.) like the following, which is taken from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/b26361760cefb540ac625702ea8639b0c5767107/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/JavaAstVisitorTest.java:  ```java     /**      * If a visit method is not overridden, we should explain why we do not 'visit' the      * parse tree at this node and construct an AST. Reasons could include that we have      * no terminal symbols (tokens) in the corresponding production rule, or that      * we handle the construction of this particular AST in it's parent node. If we      * have a production rule where we have terminal symbols (tokens), but we do not build      * an AST from tokens in the rule context, the rule is extraneous.      */  ```  Here are some statistics from using our ANTLR Javadoc grammar to parse this javadoc:  ``` Input size: 518 char, 8 lines Number of tokens: 476 Parse time (ms): 281.922 Prediction time (ms): 256.538 = 91.00% Lookahead burden: 15439/476 = 32.43 Deepest lookahead: k = 87  ```  With Checkstyle's javadoc grammar, this one javadoc contains 400 ambiguities and 423 predicates (all are invocations of `isNextJavadocTag()`). We can also see that the lookahead burden is significant. This statistic is found by dividing the total number of lookahead symbols examined while parsing the entire input by the total number of tokens parsed. The large number of tokens parsed is due to manner in which text is handled; individual characters are sent from the lexer to the parser, via TokenStream. The characters are then essentially "lexed" again, in the `text` production rule:  ```antlr  text : ((CHAR | WS)  {   _la = _input.LA(1);   if ((_la != WS) && (_la != CHAR)) return _localctx;   else if (_alt == 1) continue;  }        )+;  ```  This results in a very large parse tree of individual characters, and very poor performance. Example of generated parse tree:  ``` ... [@7,15:15='I',,2:7] [@8,16:16='f',,2:8] [@9,17:17=' ',,2:9] [@10,18:18='a',,2:10] [@11,19:19=' ',,2:11] [@12,20:20='v',,2:12] [@13,21:21='i',,2:13] [@14,22:22='s',,2:14] [@15,23:23='i',,2:15] [@16,24:24='t',,2:16] ... ```  Here is a visual example of how our grammar tokenizes this input:  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31252532/149449032-77637b2f-9e15-44b1-8b5a-8c99578ff99e.png)  Ideally, some sort of `TEXT` token should be emitted from the lexer, so that we do not have to deal with giant parse trees and re-lexing characters in the parser. In this case, the example javadoc's token stream would consist of about 20-30 tokens.   Another issue that could be affecting performance is the large number of semantic predicates (such as `{!isNextJavadocTag()}?`) on the left hand side of parser rules. When a semantic predicate appears on the LHS of a rule, this particular rule or alternative is not cached.  --------------------------  For comparison, here is the stats for the same javadoc, parsed by the ANTLR javadoc grammar:  ``` Input size: 518 char, 8 lines Number of tokens: 190 Parse time (ms): 36.79 Prediction time (ms): 34.672 = 94.24% Lookahead burden: 5704/190 = 30.02 Deepest lookahead: k = 187  ```  The ANTLR4 grammar parses this javadoc almost 8 times faster than Checkstyle's javadoc grammar. It contains 169 ambiguities and 0 predicates (all of ANTLR's parser grammars are action free).  ---------------------------  Also for comparison, here is the statistics from our java grammar for parsing the entire input (including comments) at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/b26361760cefb540ac625702ea8639b0c5767107/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/JavaAstVisitorTest.java:  ``` Input size: 8664 char, 193 lines Number of tokens: 806 Parse time (ms): 222.904 Prediction time (ms): 204.465 = 91.73% Lookahead burden: 4558/806 = 5.66 Deepest lookahead: k = 173  ```  -------------------------  To see an example of slowed parsing in practice, please read http://roman-ivanov.blogspot.com/2016/02/performance-problem-while-using-checks.html. Here is some of the important stats from this blog post:  >Execution test that show performance degradation in 15 times (19sec vs 5m8sec):  ``` $ grep -E "JavadocTagContinuationIndentation|NonEmptyAtclauseDescription|SingleLineJavadoc|JavadocParagraph|SummaryJavadoc|AtclauseOrder|AbstractJavadoc" google_checks.xml                                                        $ grep -E "JavadocTagContinuationIndentation|NonEmptyAtclauseDescription|SingleLineJavadoc|JavadocParagraph|SummaryJavadoc|AtclauseOrder|AbstractJavadoc" google_checks_only-one-javadoc-check.xml           $ grep -E "JavadocTagContinuationIndentation|NonEmptyAtclauseDescription|SingleLineJavadoc|JavadocParagraph|SummaryJavadoc|AtclauseOrder" google_checks_no-javadoc-checks.xml $  $ time java -jar checkstyle-6.15-all.jar -c google_checks_no-javadoc-checks.xml guava/ Starting audit... Audit done.  real 0m19.532s user 0m56.985s sys 0m0.807s  $ time java -jar checkstyle-6.15-all.jar -c google_checks.xml guava/ Starting audit... Audit done.  real 5m8.913s user 6m25.283s sys 0m1.287s  $ time java -jar checkstyle-6.15-all.jar -c google_checks_only-one-javadoc-check.xml guava/ Starting audit... Audit done.  real 5m7.450s user 6m14.414s sys 0m1.179s  ```  -------------------------  To fix this issue, we should start with a deeper investigation into the problem areas of the grammar, and generate a report to share here. We should be open to the possibility of a complete rewrite of both the lexer and parser grammar.

column3: ImportControlLoader does not throw exception on unrecognized element
column4: ConfigurationLoader throws an exception for unrecognized elements while using custom DTD but ImportControlLoader does not-  ### ConfigurationLoader ``` ➜  java git:(master) ✗ diff configuration_1_3.dtd configuration_custom.dtd  8c8 <  --- >  52a53,58 >     value CDATA #REQUIRED > > >  >  >      name NMTOKEN #REQUIRED   ➜  java git:(master) ✗ cat config.xml                                           ➜  java git:(master) ✗ java -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unknown name:newelement.         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.ConfigurationLoader$InternalLoader.startElement(ConfigurationLoader.java:552)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(AbstractSAXParser.java:510)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(AbstractXMLDocumentParser.java:183)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.dtd.XMLDTDValidator.emptyElement(XMLDTDValidator.java:752)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:1377)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDriver.next(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:2710)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentScannerImpl.next(XMLDocumentScannerImpl.java:605)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:534)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:888)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:824)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:141)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1216)         at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(SAXParserImpl.java:635)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.XmlLoader.parseInputSource(XmlLoader.java:79)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.ConfigurationLoader.parseInputSource(ConfigurationLoader.java:199)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.ConfigurationLoader.loadConfiguration(ConfigurationLoader.java:317)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.ConfigurationLoader.loadConfiguration(ConfigurationLoader.java:268)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:372)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126) ```  ### ImportControlLoader ``` ➜  java git:(master) ✗ diff import_control_1_4.dtd InputImportControlCustomDtd.dtd  11c11 <  --- >  31c31 <  --- >  100a101,104 >  >  >      %attlist.importrule;>    ➜  java git:(master) ✗ cat config.xml                              ➜  java git:(master) ✗ cat InputImportControlCustomDtd.xml                       ➜  java git:(master) ✗ java -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  Just like `ConfigurationLoader`, `ImportControlLoader` should also throw an exception when it sees an unrecognized element.

column3: Issue #11720: Kill surviving mutation in VariableDeclarationUsageDistanceCheck in getFirstNodeInsideIfBlock
column4: Closes #11720  Check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#VariableDeclarationUsageDistance  ### Diff Reports (Issue for NPE at #11973):  - validateBetweenScopesFalse: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/78d2c37_2022195745/reports/diff/index.html - validateBetweenScopesTrue: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/78d2c37_2022043220/reports/diff/index.html  ### Rationale  There is no need to loop and check all the statements in the `if-else` chain at once, just check the current statement, the next statement (if present), and the outer method i.e. `calculateDistanceBetweenScopes` will iterate over the remaining branches, we just add the head of the remaining branches to `variableUsageExpressions` for it to be analyzed in the next iteration.  ---  ### Generating reports again:  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Vyom-Yadav/98dceb63a79f4833e85fff9b2e1464a6/raw/a06fa3c8f525c4466a67c1ee057d4ed843db2301/my_checks.xml Report label: validateBetweenScopesTrue

column3: Issue #11309: Replace usages of deprecated method AccessibleObject.is…
column4: Closes #11309.  From https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/reflect/AccessibleObject.html#trySetAccessible():  > Set the accessible flag for this reflected object to true if possible. This method sets the accessible flag, as if by invoking [setAccessible(true)](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/reflect/AccessibleObject.html#setAccessible(boolean)), and returns the possibly-updated value for the accessible flag. If access cannot be enabled, i.e. the checks or Java language access control cannot be suppressed, this method returns false (as opposed to setAccessible(true) throwing InaccessibleObjectException when it fails).

column3: Issue #11286: EmptyLineSeparator can now also check empty lines after block start and before block end
column4: Closes #11286: EmptyLineSeparator can now also check empty lines after block start and before block end.  To enable checking of empty line separator also after block start (left curly): * Added property `requireEmptyLineAfterBlockStart`. The default is `false` for backward compatibility.  to enable checking of _no_ empty line separator before block end (right curly): * Added allowed token `RCURLY` to allow also checking before this token. This is _not_ included in the default for backward compatibility. * Added property `allowNoEmptyLineBeforeBlockEnd`. The default is `false` for backward compatibility. This requires the above `RCURLY` to be included in tokens to work. * Added message "no.empty.line.separator" for these violations of empty lines before block end that should not be there. EN, DE, FR, ES translations done.  Known issues: * FI, JA, PT, TR, ZH translations for the new message are TODO, which makes the build fail. I'll need some help translating those. I can use Google Translate, but even that will be very challenging for languages such as JA. * JaCoCo fails with 96 % coverage, apparently I am missing some branches, but I don't know which ones. When I run `EmptyLineSeparatorCheckTest` in IntelliJ, it shows me 100 % class/method/line coverage, so I don't know which branches I am missing... I can figure this out for myself if I spend some time investigating, but if someone could point me in the right direction that would help.

column3: Issue #11220: False positive in MissingSwitchDefault with pattern in switch label
column4: Closes #11220   Report label: all projects  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/3db3e23a5063857160d7d92cbdfa1bfe/raw/b8fc9b284c6604bf0862f237f030794bfb0a7800/config.xml  Diff Regression projects: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/checkstyle/contribution/e34312d61da0b073f31339cfbf385f289b721fed/checkstyle-tester/projects-to-test-on-for-github-action.properties  Final report: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/f5590ec_2022232703/reports/diff/index.html  Only diffs are in openjdk17, in noncompilable files. I am not sure if we should add files filters for these files, though, since they are how I confirmed logic of check update. I think that they might be valuable in the future for similar reasons.  Blocked until https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11100  Only last commit is under review.  Example of compile error on new enum value: ``` $ cat Test.java  public class Test { enum Color { RED, GREEN, BLUE, MY_COLOR }  /**  * In the case of switch expressions, the compiler requires  * that they are exhaustive, so this check does not enforce  * a default label. This code would still compile with a  * default label, but it is unnecessary so this check does  * not enforce it.  */ static int showSwitchExpressionExhaustiveness(Color color) {     switch (color) {         case RED: System.out.println("RED"); break;         case BLUE: System.out.println("BLUE"); break;         case GREEN: System.out.println("GREEN"); break;         // Check will require default label below, compiler         // does not enforce a switch statement with constants         // to be complete.         //default: System.out.println("Something else");     }      // Check will not require default label in switch     // expression below, because code will not compile     // if all possible values are not handled. If the     // 'Color' enum is extended, code will fail to compile.     return switch (color) {         case RED:             yield 1;         case GREEN:             yield 2;         case BLUE:             yield 3;     }; }    }  $ javac --enable-preview --release 17 Test.java  Test.java:26: error: the switch expression does not cover all possible input values     return switch (color) {            ^ 1 error  ```

column3: Issue #10848: Support patterns in switch
column4: Closes #10848.  Relevant grammar from https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/preview/specs/patterns-switch-jls.html:  ```  SwitchBlock:     { SwitchRule {SwitchRule} }     { {SwitchBlockStatementGroup} {SwitchLabel :} }  SwitchRule:     SwitchLabel -> Expression ;     SwitchLabel -> Block     SwitchLabel -> ThrowStatement  SwitchBlockStatementGroup:     SwitchLabel : BlockStatements  SwitchLabel:     CaseOrDefaultLabel {: CaseOrDefaultLabel }  CaseOrDefaultLabel:     case CaseLabelElement {, CaseLabelElement }     default  CaseLabelElement:     CaseConstant     Pattern     null     default  ```  --------------------------------------- [Relevant grammar for patterns](https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/406):  ``` Pattern:   PrimaryPattern   GuardedPattern  GuardedPattern:   PrimaryPattern && ConditionalAndExpression  PrimaryPattern:   TypePattern   ( Pattern )  ```   ------------------------------------------ Also, minor update to `instanceof`:  From https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/406: ``` We also change the grammar for instanceof expressions to:  InstanceofExpression:   RelationalExpression instanceof ReferenceType   RelationalExpression instanceof PrimaryPattern  ```  ------------------------------------  Just a test here, I noticed that PMD release in projects files is not up to date.  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/ea9cd53c4dc4be8be3e776d059542f00/raw/6eb067547d67808e3bbab428a4e2dad7a031676d/pmd.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/3db3e23a5063857160d7d92cbdfa1bfe/raw/a200e0fb1c4700ecd084f9e0b03bf7dbb9694832/config.xml  ---------------------------  ## ANTLR regression report  https://nmancus1.github.io/issue-10848/issue-10848-antlr-diff-pmd-checkstyle/index.html  All diffs are exceptions vs files we can parse now. ______________________________________________  ## column3: Add ignoreMethodAnnotatedBy property to ParameterNumberCheck
column4: Check name: [ParameterNumberCheck](https://checkstyle.org/config_sizes.html#ParameterNumber)  ## Problem  https://www.baeldung.com/jackson-annotations#1-jsoncreator https://fasterxml.github.io/jackson-annotations/javadoc/2.7/com/fasterxml/jackson/annotation/JsonCreator.html If I implement external API, I have no power over the number of parameters, e.g. when creating a DTO class for REST API and deserializing JSON to an object by constructor annotated by @JsonCreator  ``` class MyDto {   private final String a1;   private final String a2;   private final String a3;   private final String a4;   private final String a5;   private final String a6;   private final String a7;   private final String a8;   private final String a9;    @JsonCreator   MyDto(String a1, String a2, String a3, String a4, String a5, String a6, String a7, String a8, String a9) {     this.a1 = a1;     this.a2 = a2;     this.a3 = a3;     this.a4 = a4;     this.a5 = a5;     this.a6 = a6;     this.a7 = a7;     this.a8 = a8;     this.a9 = a9;   } } ```  ## Solution  I'd like to configure check to ignore this constructor. In general, ignore all methods annotated by `@JsonCreator`, e.g.  ```             ```  The PR with the proposal is here https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11339  Check already has property `ignoreOverriddenMethods`  so new property will make it more general.
